intro: Oncostylis dubia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oncostylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Oncostylis dubia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
